body:
ok, I followed the guide over at [1] to enable symlinks in my windows, and to allow my git clone to use symlinks.
Required me to enable developer mode. git config core.symlinks true. delete extensions/kubernetes-service-binding/runtime/src/test/resources/k8s/test-k8s/.hidden-symlink-dir. and `it restore extensions/kubernetes-service-binding/runtime/src/test/resources/k8s/test-k8s/.hidden-symlink-dir


[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5917249/git-symbolic-links-in-windows/59761201#59761201


However, on mvnw -quickly I now get this one:

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-resources-plugin:3.3.1:testResources (default-testResources) on project quarkus-kuber

```
`mvnw -Dquickly` now works after following the guide over at: https://stackoverflow.com/a/65504258

without gpedit and developer mode: does not build
without gpedit, with developer mode: does not build
with gpedit, with developer mode: does build
with gpedit, without developer mode: does build

so in the end, the gpedit alone from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32877260/privlege-error-trying-to-create-symlink-using-python-on-windows-10/65504258#65504258 solves this specific problem

issue.title: Contributing guide, add section about allowing windows symlinks
Disable kubernetes-service-binding testing on Windows
issue.body:
It uses symlinks and they are complex to allow on Windows. Let's not ask our users to go do crazy things to test this particular module.

Fixes #45860
Related to #42756
